definition: to raise (animals)/to bring up (children)/to keep (pets)/to support/to give birth

sentences.english: He grows crops, domesticates animals and builds comfortable homes for himself.
sentences.chinese: 他種玉米，馴養動物，爲自己建立舒適的家。

sentences.english: Last week, we saw a documentary about two domestic animals.
sentences.chinese: 上週，我們看了一場關於兩隻馴養的動物的記錄片。

sentences.english: By many all-night vigils , passions he tamed.
sentences.chinese: 由許多通宵的守夜，他馴養了的熱情。

sentences.english: But packed within its borders is a highly concentrated mixture of things wild and domesticated.
sentences.chinese: 但是在它的區域內是野生和馴養的高度濃縮。

sentences.english: Article 17. The state shall encourage the domestication and breeding of wildlife.
sentences.chinese: 第十七條國家鼓勵馴養繁殖野生動物。

sentences.english: The origin of the fete of horse is the adoration of horse and those ancestors who first domesticated horses.
sentences.chinese: 馬社起源於對馬和最早開始馴養馬的祖先的崇拜。

sentences.english: Trainer safety with Tilikum is a serious concern.
sentences.chinese: Tilikum馴養員的安全是個很嚴肅的問題。

sentences.english: If you domesticate this raccoon,it will have trouble living in the wild.
sentences.chinese: 如果你馴養這隻浣熊，它生活在野外將會有困難。

sentences.english: I plant the potatoes, I weed the garden, I domesticate the species.
sentences.chinese: 我種植馬鈴薯，替花園除草，馴養各種動植物。

sentences.english: The tame bird was in a cage， the free bird was in the forest.
sentences.chinese: 馴養的鳥在籠裏，自由的鳥在林中。

sentences.english: Ancient Egyptians may have first domesticated cats as early as 4, 000 years ago.
sentences.chinese: 早在4，000年前，古埃及人是第一批馴養貓的人。

sentences.english: How did domestication of large animals affect human cultural history?
sentences.chinese: 馴養大型動物對人類文化史有什麼影響？

sentences.english: Ariel is associated with lions and other animals of the non-domesticated kind.
sentences.chinese: 亞列爾與獅子及其他未被馴養的動物有關。

definition: to amuse oneself/to play with/to tease
to be unable to withstand a single blow/to collapse at the first blow
